summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report detailing the self-mutilation/suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on July 23, 2019. The report describes staff finding Epstein with a homemade rope around his neck and his cellmate alerting them to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted to hang himself in his SHU cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was at the cell door and alerted staff that Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

persons.name: Alnigra
persons.context: A correctional officer who grabbed door keys and called for assistance during the response to Epstein's suicide attempt.

connections.description: They were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the time of the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to hang himself in his cell using a homemade orange rope. Staff found him breathing but unresponsive, removed the rope, and transported him from the SHU.

locations: NCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide by hanging in his prison cell on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM.
The incident occurred in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein's cellmate, Tartaglione, alerted staff to the incident.
Staff found Epstein with an orange homemade rope around his neck; he was breathing but unresponsive.
The incident was officially classified as 'Self-Mutilation' under Prohibited Act Code 228.
